description: Built in 1914, this castle on a hill overlooking Toronto is regarded as a treasured heritage landmark. At Casa Loma, you can explore three levels of elaborately decorated rooms, including the Conservatory which has Italian marble floors and Ontario marble side panels. Permanent exhibitions and special exhibits here feature early Canadian history. The castle is also a popular place for private events, and serves as a backdrop for film and photo shoots. There's even a steakhouse located within the grounds offering the finest beef from all over the world. The tour of Casa Loma is self-guided but multimedia audio guides are available. – Tripadvisor

reviews.title: Great experience but needs live guides
text: We got Senior Citizen tickets and spent about two hours visiting this attraction.
If you are a film buff, you will recognise this castle from "X-Men" and "Ready Or Not" (on Hulu), there are many other movies that have used the property as a background or interior set.
The highest turret is a claustrophobic climb for some folks, but there is a fantastic 260° view of Toronto that is almost worth the price of the tour.
I gave it one star deduction for the audio tour; they should have docents giving guided tours, that would make the Casa Loma a true 5-star experience!

reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations!
text: Legends of Horror 2024 exceeded our expectations! Hollywood quality props, decorations, animatronics, costumes, actors & performers. Eerie-spooky atmosphere, plenty of jump scares, creepy passageways & underground tunnels... the attention to detail throughout was stunning! The costumed actors who quietly crept after us, suddenly materialized, leered at us and jump-scared the heck out of us were the absolute best part. Far better than any Halloween walk-through we've been to at some major amusement parks!

reviews.title: Wonderful visit
text: I visited Casa Loma in October 2024.  For convenience I took Uber there.  The outside of the Casa Loma is a great photo opportunity.  I did a self-guided tour.  On the ground floor, the Library, the Conservatory and the Great Hall were memorable.  The second floor had many wonderful rooms.  The third floor was dedicated to Canadian military history and very interesting.  I did not go up to the towers.  I went back to the basement and ate lunch in the cafe.  There is a gift shop also.  I look forward to visiting Casa Loma again during the spring or summer.

reviews.title: Large House
text: The historical house of Casa Loma is within easy reach by the metro. There's a guild and self guided tours available. The map is also useful to get your bearings as it's on four different levels. Simply follow the numbers and you won't miss a thing.

reviews.title: Identity crisis
text: This place, I think, has a bit of an identity crisis. I think it is trying to be several different attractions all in one, and I’m not sure it works. On the one hand the stately home was nice and informative. Then when you go down to the basement and tunnel you had corpses swinging from chains in the tunnels. Then above the stables you have celebrity wax works. Found it really bizzare. But was an ok visit. Not sure I would return.

reviews.title: Amazing
text: We travelled to Casa Loma on the hop on hop off bus which is a good way to get there, and they sold discount tickets for Casa Loma on board.  This house is the most opulent and extravagant residence I have ever seen which isn’t a royal palace or the home of a member of the aristocracy.  It really is incredible and definitely worth a visit.  If the weather had been better, the views over the city from the towers would have been spectacular.  There is an audio tour which you can get on your phone so you can learn lots about this unique house.

reviews.title: Extremely well maintain unusual North American castle
text: Its not an inexpensive place to visit, but its worth it.  Extremely well maintain unusual North American castle.  We really enjoyed our tour.  Would love to come back some time and try dinner.

reviews.title: Many memories
text: It's a very big mansion. It has already been used for military events. It has hosted so many memories. Our guide explained everything at length.

reviews.title: Disneyfied historic house
text: Disneyland of historical houses. Pretty grounds, but filled with crap like escape rooms, halloween stuff, and other material that hides the historic nature of the building. The original belongings were sold off in bankruptcy and there isn’t really much to tie the furniture there now to what it was when Pellatt built it.  Main stairwell comes from a hotel that was started in the building in the 1920s. Spadina across the street is far more interesting.

reviews.title: Nice building but nothing new to see if you're coming from Europe
text: If you live in  (or have travelled) Europe, you'll have seen houses, mansions and castles that are way older and way more interesting than this one.

It's a beautiful building with a somewhat interesting history, but there isn't that much to see that I hadn't seen elsewhere, especially in the UK. The interiors and decor are the same, nothing new or remarkable worth seeing.

However, they were decorating the tunnels for the Halloween events so we got to see them too, which was a bonus. Overall, I didn't  think it was worth paying for. However, if you don't have older buildings or castles where you live, this may be worth a visit.

reviews.title: Casa Loma, Toronto
text: Well worth going to, I went by HOHO bus from the harbour. Stunning building with loads to see in multiple furnished rooms.
Nice panini lunch in the indoor cafe too. Lots to explore & see in the house & gardens with views over Toronto.

reviews.title: Very fun attraction and view into the past!
text: Our family of 5 purchased the City Pass (highly recommended to cut the costs of activities!) and went to Casa Loma while on a family vacation.  We easily spent 3+ hours here walking around the grounds/castle and taking in some great views of Downtown skyline.  Very fun to walk thru what amounts to a real life “Clue” board game, see actual rooms where popular movies were filmed.  Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Nice stone castle in Toronto with great views
text: Casa Loma is certainly picturesque from the outside. The great stone structure is very charming. We visited in the morning on a weekday and was quite full with tour bus visitors. The interior shows how the place was used back then and explains a lot of the history of the place and its owners. The terrace gives a nice view of Toronto. Make the effort to go up the Scottish Tower for a panoramic view of Toronto, only best by CN Tower, Toronto Islands or Riverdale Park. The tunnel to the stables is also an interesting part of the visit. Alot of Toronto's history is also described throughout the tunnel and the house.

reviews.title: A fun day at Prellatt's
text: This was an amazing venue if you are interested in local history and indulgent architecture and living. We ended up spending 3 hours there and I am sure we missed stuff. Dont buy your tickets online cheaper at the door as there is no booking fee.

reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
text: If you have, or are thinking of purchasing tickets for Symphony in the Garden at Casa Loma DON'T!

My daughter and I have attended this event every year (except last year due to prolonged illness) and have always looked forward to it. The tickets are reasonably priced but be aware, the food and drink is VERY pricey.
Last night we had tickets for the 7:30 p.m. performance. As in prior years, we arrived at 5:00 p.m. to ensure we got a table and could have dinner with a glass or two of wine.
In past years, the line up was at the front door, we would enter Casa Loma and enjoy walking through the building maybe using the beautiful bathrooms then would head through to the garden for dinner.

Last evening the line up was through the parking lot and around the side of the building. After standing in the hot parking lot for 35 minutes our tickets were checked and our hands stamped. We continued waiting in line. A short time later we were directed to porta potties since the building was closed. We continued waiting in a very slow moving line. After 50 minutes in line, we were told there were no more tables. When we asked about having dinner, we were told we could go to a counter and get something to eat...I guess cafeteria style without anywhere to sit with our 'snack'.

I realize processes sometimes change after a time...my complaint is that arriving 2.5 hrs ahead of the performance (this has always been more than enough time!) and then being met with a 'cattlecall' type of line up for hours! Portable toilets etc. It was a stark difference to the gracious experience we have enjoyed in the past. We had paid at this point and were not in a position for a refund. Meanwhile the event having used Casa Loma's name and grounds for crowd draw, denied access to said building and throughly cheapened the entire experience. In fact, it felt VERY much like without informing patrons of process change, they accepted money (over sold!) from patrons who didn't have a hope of having an (expensive) sit down meal without refund, filled their tables and made ALOT of money! Misleading at it's finest in my opinion!
Had we been informed of this process change, I would not have traveled three hours and stood in a hot parking lot for over and hour.
We will never grace the door again!
We feel VERY mislead and paid $100. receiving nothing!
Save your money and attend a concert where tickets are not KNOWLY over sold and you can be sure you will receive what you paid for.
SHAME ON YOU CASA LOMA!!

reviews.title: Loved if
text: I had no idea what to expect visiting, but this ended up being one of my favorite sites in Toronto! The castle was truly magical

reviews.title: Recommend it.
text: Beautiful palace with gardens. There's nothing else to it. A uphill walk from Dupont station, but there is signage. Add this to your plan.

reviews.title: A grand history and pretty scenes
text: As a kid growing up in Western New York and visiting Toronto often, this was a place I’d always wanted to see. Our family of three really enjoyed the majesty of the place and the stories that go along with it. The views of Toronto were pretty spectacular too. Highly recommend watching the movie on the lower floor. Definitely worth a visit.

reviews.title: Casa Loma - Cool experience
text: Wow, this place was amazing. Cool to see the history of it - that it wasn't royal or anything. The castle, the grounds, the tunnels, the stables - all of it was so beautiful! And I loved that you were able to enter into the bedrooms (part of it was roped off, but you still were able to walk in or through it to the next room. Also you got to see where the staff slept and you can go to the roof!

reviews.title: Needs work, tons of deferred maintenance.  Could be nice if they would maintain it
text: This could be nice, or maybe once it was. But there is a lot of deferred maintenance. No metal was polished. Most wood work was not dusted. Walls and furniture showed a lot of wear and tear. They charged $20 parking and $35 per person to get in and both times I went there they were swamped!  Where is the money going?
Not to maintenance!!
To bad

reviews.title: Worth a look…
text: We had a few hours to kill while in Toronto so we decided to check out this castle. It was humongous with lots of rooms and wealth throughout. Great views of the city from the upper towers. Worth seeing if you got a couple hours.

reviews.title: Look beyond Disney feel to an interesting historical figure
text: We recently visited Casa Loma, a house built to fulfill a dream and a hankering back to a historical homeland by a spendthrift baronet, over a century ago.

I admit we where initially put off the place by the ‘Disney’ themed entrance and surly youth employed there (they are in serious need of customer service training!)  This venue is operated by an entertainment group, who also undertake weddings and once this is understood the property makes more sense.

As we explored further, we did enjoy our experience more as we learnt about the couple who built the house and the occurrences which happened to them.  Many of the upstairs rooms have been recreated according to contemporary photographs and the character actors were good historians, adding greatly to the ambiance.

We came away with a greater understanding of the life & times of Sir Henry & Lady Mary Pellatt,  life leading up to WW1 and the Great Depression.   It is worth a visit if you’re in the vicinity once your expectations have been managed as this is not run like a British National Trust establishment!
Be aware that you cannot leave the Casa & renter the premises - even to go to your car parked on the premises!  A shame that other venues can resolve this simple issue, but not this operator.

reviews.title: Worthwhile
text: My husband and I toured Casa Loma and both enjoyed it.  There is plenty to see and to read about and it will likely take you at least 2 hours or more to get the full experience. It's self guided so you can take as much time (or as little time) as suits you to view each room/display.
It is a lot of walking, and there are  a  few staircases to navigate but we're in our sixties and managed fine.

My one issue is that there are very few (I can only think of 2 places) to sit. What I find is that sometimes one person may take longer than another to view a display.  That leaves one person waiting around. That's not necessarily a bad thing, but having benches placed throughout the castle would definitely be helpful.  For example,  at the car garage, there's a  "celebrity exhibit" that requires you to walk up a spiral set of stairs.  I didn't go up, but my husband did.  It would have been nice to have a place to sit while waiting for him to return. There are a few places like that throughout the castle for which a bench would be a welcome addition.
Otherwise, it's a fascinating place to visit. We recommend it.

reviews.title: Waited out in rain two hours for Symphony event
text: Went for the Symphony event and on the website they told us to arrive at the gates by 5pm. It was raining and they never opened the gates and let people stand in the rain for two hours with no explanation. No refund either and I came with my family who paid over $200 drove down all the way to Toronto for this event.

reviews.title: Not a lot for your money
text: Casa Loma was built by a wealthy Canadian businessman who wanted to recreate a fairy tale castle to live in. However funny, it is honestly not worth the price nor the journey. There is actually not much to see inside the house and the overall experience feels really artificial.

reviews.title: The Dream Castle
text: It was amazing , the view great from the Towers . Underground tunnels really took you back in time .
Everything was spectacular even the Lunch In the garden. Took lots of pictures.

reviews.title: Visit Casa Loma
text: This is definitely worth visiting. The castle is huge and there is so much to see and a lot of history to read about while inside.

reviews.title: Delightful catering manager
text: Besides the amazing property and explanations, we ate at the grill outside. I didn't get my order and complained. The manager, Rodrigo Cugliari, came and immediately ordered my meal. He also apologized profusely and escorted us to get a refund on our entry tickets. Such a delightful and charming man! He also told us many things about the castle. It made our visit especially meaningful. Thank you Rodrigo.

reviews.title: Spooked out
text: I was 10 years old and remember well, the 'tunnels" today are what they called a dungeon, I and my classmates saw with our own eyes chains and handcuffs on the side walls and a peculiar room with swords which looked like a torment room for punishment...lots if hidden doors in the rooms  leading outside and in the dungeons...these are probably sealed off or  destroyed today cause nothing s there but tunnels....you figure it out?

reviews.title: Self-Lead Tour
text: We wondered to Casa Loma on a very hot July day and were not disappointed! A beautiful building and filled with rich history and other exhibits we explored the halls and rooms for hours. I do not regret that we went but would recommend going during a cooler part of the day or season if you are sensitive to heat. The Library was my favorite room and the movie information in the basement was a wonderful must-see!

reviews.title: Beautiful structure
text: The mansion is lovely with lots of areas to view the interior rooms.  The 3rd floor is primarily a military museum and I really was able to appreciate all that I didn’t know about the Canadian military activity
Only negative- the self guided tour was cumbersome to use.  Most folks I observed seemed to be just viewing without commentary

reviews.title: Casa Loma Toronto
text: Very historic building. Lots to see. Please plan for a two hour visit.Accesible by public transit .We can go back to visit for Thanksgiving

reviews.title: Very big residence with uncanny features. Very interesting visit.
text: We had never heard about this residence until looking for things to do in Toronto. The self-guided tour was a very interesting. The house is gigantic, and the highlight is for sure the tunnel going to the garage/stables. It is hard to believe that one gentleman built such a big residence for his own use, yet his plans were bigger. Great visit, and we are so happy we decided to give it a try. We went around 10am -- bus tours stop by the house, and we imagine that it can get very crowded as the day goes on.

reviews.title: Great experience exceptional service
text: Went to the Rock Symphony show. Fantastic experience. Julia who works there was a superstar. She remembered us from a previous visit and found us some great seats. Give Julia a promotion!

reviews.title: Family Hours Lengends Of Horrors.
text: I went with my 14 year old sons his friends and my 10 year old daughter. I thought I was fairly scary but my daughter thought I’d was fun but not that scary she now wants to go for the non family hours this year with her friends . Last time I went it was scary but I can’t send them in alone for they are only in grade 7. Overall it was really fun and looking forward to sending the husband in with them this year.

reviews.title: Take a picture of the building and move along
text: Casa Loma is a beautiful building on the outside. But the inside and the management are lacking. There are so many paintings that are withering away in the poor lighting. I'm sure they could acquire much better paintings or perhaps find a way to preserve what they have. There are many spaces in the building that require retracing your steps and going up the down staircase or going up a very very narrow staircase. The air conditioning is poor as well. If we didn't look so hard, we would have missed all the classic cars and all the wax figures. The long hallway is CRAZY long and there is no music or anything to read along the way to keep you and your group entertained. The restaurants on site are so strange when you are trying to admire the architecture and you aren't allowed into the rooms. The gift shop is so small and hardly has anything of value. There is a great room to watch a video on the history but its very short.
I've been to other historic homes and the experience is so unique. I was very disappointed here especially for the cost.

reviews.title: The historic beauty
text: A beautiful historic place is Casaloma. This place was awesome. It's pricey. The tip from my side please leave a lot of time to explore. We were here for most of the day.

There are several places where you can buy food and beverages on site. Prices were expensive, but portions were large. We explore everything including both towers and the underground tunnel area as well as the grounds.

The view from the tower where you can go outside is quite good. Casa Loma is a must-see when visiting Toronto. Car parking was quite difficult but I have a suggestion, people can go by public transport like subway and the station is Spadina. And Spadina station is the most beautiful subway station among Toronto. Public transport system is very smooth and easy.

reviews.title: So Much to Explore
text: This place was awesome. It's pricey, but we feel like we got our money's worth. Leave a lot of time to explore. We were here for most of the day. There are several places where you can buy food and beverages on site. Prices were expensive, but portions were large. There are a lot of people here, so sometimes areas get logjammed. We took our time and made sure to explore everything including both towers and the underground tunnel area as well as the grounds. The view from the tower where you can go outside is quite good. I will say that they are currently setting up for their Halloween event and small children might be scared by some of that, but it's limited to the tunnel and the ground, so it's fairly easy to avoid. In my opinion, Casa Loma is a must-see when visiting Toronto.

reviews.title: A Beautiful Dream
text: Allow time to thoroughly explore this beautiful estate. We did not so I feel we missed lots of opportunity to experience treasure. We were on a group trip with a bus and parking was difficult. I imagine parking overall in this area would be challenging.

reviews.title: Sunset Concert Disaster
text: Tickets start at $50 and they don't have anywhere near enough seating. This is a recurring ticketed event, it's completely unacceptable that they fail to prepare adequately.
